meanings.definition: Bolshies (noun): Informal term for members of the Bolshevik party in Russia.
meanings.sent1: The bolshies gathered to discuss their plans for the upcoming protest.
meanings.sent2: She learned about the bolshies in her history class.
meanings.sent3: The bolshies decided to have a potluck to celebrate their achievements.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were so radical, they labeled him as one of the bolshies.
meanings.sent5: The image of the bolshies marching with banners was etched in her mind.

meanings.definition: Bolshies (adjective): Relating to or characteristic of the Bolshevik party.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed artifacts from the bolshies era.
meanings.sent2: Her grandfather shared stories of the bolshies revolution.
meanings.sent3: The bolshies-themed party decorations were a hit with the guests.
meanings.sent4: The bolshies influence could be seen in the city's architecture.
meanings.sent5: She wore a bolshies-inspired outfit to the historical event.

meanings.definition: Bolshies (verb): To act in a radical or revolutionary manner.
meanings.sent1: They decided to bolshies against the unjust laws.
meanings.sent2: She always wanted to bolshies for a cause she believed in.
meanings.sent3: The students planned to bolshies by organizing a peaceful protest.
meanings.sent4: He was known to bolshies whenever he felt something was unfair.
meanings.sent5: The community came together to bolshies for change in their neighborhood.
